speaker: macbeth
dialog: If it were done when 'tis done, then 'twere well It were done quickly:

speaker: macbeth
dialog: If the assassination could trammel up the consequence, and catch with his surcease success; that but this blow might be the be-all and the end-all here,

speaker: macbeth
dialog: But here, upon this bank and shoal of time, we'ld jump the life to come.

speaker: macbeth
dialog: But in these cases we still have judgment here;

speaker: macbeth
dialog: that we but teach bloody instructions, which, being taught, return to plague the inventor:

speaker: macbeth
dialog: this even-handed justice commends the ingredients of our poison'd chalice to our own lips.

speaker: macbeth
dialog: He's here in double trust; first, as I am his kinsman and his subject, strong both against the deed;

speaker: macbeth
dialog: then, as his host, who should against his murderer shut the door, not bear the knife myself.

speaker: macbeth
dialog: Besides, this Duncan hath borne his faculties so meek,

speaker: macbeth
dialog: hath been so clear in his great office, that his virtues will plead like angels, trumpet-tongued, against the deep damnation of his taking-off;

speaker: macbeth
dialog: And pity, like a naked new-born babe, striding the blast, or heaven's cherubim,

speaker: macbeth
dialog: horsed upon the sightless couriers of the air, shall blow the horrid deed in every eye, that tears shall drown the wind.

speaker: macbeth
dialog: I have no spur to prick the sides of my intent, but only vaulting ambition, which o'erleaps itself and falls on the other.

speaker: ladymacbeth
dialog: What's up bitches

speaker: macbeth
dialog: How now, what news?

speaker: ladymacbeth
dialog: He has almost supp'd: why have you left the chamber?

speaker: macbeth
dialog: Hath he ask'd for me?

speaker: ladymacbeth
dialog: Know you not he has?

speaker: macbeth
dialog: We will proceed no further in this business:

speaker: macbeth
dialog: He hath honour'd me of late; and I have bought golden opinions from all sorts of people, which would be worn now in their newest gloss, not cast aside so soon.

speaker: ladymacbeth
dialog: Was the hope drunk wherein you dress'd yourself?

speaker: ladymacbeth
dialog: hath it slept since?

speaker: ladymacbeth
dialog: And wakes it now, to look so green and pale at what it did so freely?

speaker: ladymacbeth
dialog: From this time such I account thy love. Art thou afeard to be the same in thine own act and valour as thou art in desire?

speaker: ladymacbeth
dialog: Wouldst thou have that which thou esteem'st the ornament of life,

speaker: ladymacbeth
dialog: and live a coward in thine own esteem, letting 'I dare not' wait upon 'I would,' like the poor cat i' the adage?

speaker: macbeth
dialog: Prithee, peace: I dare do all that may become a man; who dares do more is none.

speaker: ladymacbeth
dialog: What beast was't, then, that made you break this enterprise to me?

speaker: ladymacbeth
dialog: When you durst do it, then you were a man; and, to be more than what you were, you would be so much more the man.

speaker: ladymacbeth
dialog: Nor time nor place did then adhere, and yet you would make both: they have made themselves, and that their fitness now does unmake you.

speaker: ladymacbeth
dialog: I have given suck, and know how tender 'tis to love the babe that milks me:

speaker: ladymacbeth
dialog: I would, while it was smiling in my face, have pluck'd my nipple from his boneless gums, and dash'd the brains out, had I so sworn as you have done to this.

speaker: macbeth
dialog: damn bitch you crazy
